intro: Eriocaulon sexangulare var. micronesicum, commonly known as the Micronesian narrowleaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
